definition: to rumble with thunder/clap of thunder
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
all thunder but no rain (idiom)/a lot of noise but no action
pinyin: gan1 da3 lei2 , bu4 xia4 yu3

sentences.english: In case of lightning, please stop play and take shelter immediately.
sentences.chinese: 如遇打雷閃電，請立即停止打球，到安全區暫避。

sentences.english: When it thunders you'll feel the vibration. When it rains you'll feel the mist.'
sentences.chinese: 打雷時會感到振動，下雨時能感到水霧。

sentences.english: If I say a lie, my day is thundery break off, must not very dead.
sentences.chinese: 我要是說一句假話，我天打雷劈，不得好死。

sentences.english: She was always afraid of thunder, is now uncertain what kind of scared into it.
sentences.chinese: 她總是怕打雷，現在不定嚇成什麼樣呢。

sentences.english: She was awakened during the storm by the rumbles of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 在暴風雨期間她被打雷的隆隆聲驚醒。

sentences.english: When father speaks, it is like thundering, and the wall will be shaken.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸說起話來像打雷，震得牆壁都嗡嗡直響。

sentences.english: It began as a game to pass the time while the rain fell and lightning struck.
sentences.chinese: 它起源於打雷下雨時用來消磨時間的一個遊戲。

sentences.english: Thundery weather often turns milk sour .
sentences.chinese: 打雷的天氣常常使牛奶變酸。

sentences.english: My dear, your father does not just trumpet; he thunders.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，你爸爸不止是吹號，是打雷。

sentences.english: The little girl is intensely afraid of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 這小女孩非常害怕打雷。

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
